analysis, and topic modelling', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Fully understand different neural networks (LSTM, seq2seq, etc.), different word embedding models and transfer learning.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Knowledge of packages such as Tensorflow, Pytorch, Keras, Scikit Learn, Pandas, and NLTK', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience in a data-driven software engineering environment, with an end-to-end understanding of how to leverage data to make business decisions.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0A proven track record in building and maintaining high quality, robust and maintainable code.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience building and working within a Continuous Integration framework.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Understanding of Data Warehouse concepts, ETL strategies and best practices.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0An appetite for problem solving with a creative and resourceful approach to finding the right solution for the job.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Strong communication and collaboration skills', '\xa0', 'What sets you apart:', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0You are a self-motivated and outgoing person who can work closely with business and IT stakeholders.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0You understand the relationship between data and business outcomes and can focus on long term strategies for data.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Proficiency with PostgreSQL, Teradata, Hadoop and AWS is an asset.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0You have experience working as part of an Agile Team.', 'Additional Information:', '\ufeff', 'Aviva Canada is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during all phases of the hiring process including the application process. If you require an accommodation because of a disability, we will work with you to meet your needs. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance. If you are selected for an interview and require an accommodation, you are encouraged to advise the Talent Acquisition Partner who will ', 'consult with you to determine an appropriate accommodation.']

['At Veeva, we build enterprise cloud technology that powers the biggest names in the pharmaceutical, biotech, consumer goods, chemical & cosmetics industries. Our customers make vaccines, life-saving medicines, and life-enhancing products that make a difference in everyday lives. Our technology has transformed these industries; enabling them to get critical products and services to market faster. Our core values, Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed, guide us as we make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do.', 'The Role', 'As a Data Scientist for the Andi team, you will work with Andi Product Management, Engineering, and fellow Data Scientists to support product development.', 'Andi is a solution to coordinate data across life science field teams and through different channels to support intelligent customer engagement. Andi’s Next Best Action capabilities will enable reps to make decisions in the field through the generation of suggestions and insights based on dynamic programming engines and AI.', 'Your role will be to generate and own the mathematical and behavioral models that will help drive the generation of impactful insights and suggestions. You will assist Engineering in “productizing” the code to ensure it can be scalable and repeatable. Our ideal candidate is multi-talented, with the capabilities to develop statistical, machine learning and optimization models to create scalable solutions that can be embedded within Andi.', 'This is a great opportunity for someone who is excited about using their deep Data Science expertise to help shape the product development from the early stages of Andi and can envision how Andi will enable reps to make smarter decisions in the field.', 'What You’ll Do', 'Develop advanced algorithms that solve problems of large dimensionality in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner', 'Design, develop and assess highly innovative models for adaptive predictive learning, suggestion ranking, anomaly detection, and more', 'Collaborate with Engineering to help implement machine learning algorithms and “productize" data science capabilities', 'Build and run analysis of models and algorithms in order to assess performance and identify the best algorithms to integrate into Andi', 'Ensure models and algorithms support our customers and help them drive towards more intelligent and effective engagement with their customers', 'Execute statistical and data mining techniques (e.g. hypothesis testing, machine learning and retrieval processes) on large data sets to identify trends and figures', 'Work closely with the data warehouse product team to ensure architecture is effectively developed to support algorithms embedded in Andi', 'Requirements', 'M.S. or Ph.D. in Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other quantitative disciplines. Ph.D. with at least 2 years of relevant industry experience, M.S. with 3 years of relevant industry experience.', 'Advanced in-depth specialization and experience in data analysis techniques such as: classification, pattern recognition, clustering, feature analysis, deep learning (NLP), fuzzy matching, sentiment analysis, A/B testing, active/adaptive learning ', 'Expertise in using R or Python to manipulate large data sets and develop statistical models, with the ability to accurately determine cause and effect relationships', 'Good SQL skills', 'Intellectual curiosity, along with excellent problem-solving and quantitative skills, including the ability to disaggregate issues, identify root causes and recommend solutions, even in situations with non-standard problems', 'Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to effectively explain complex problems and advocate technical solutions to Engineering', 'Nice to Have', 'Experience with commercial aspects of the Life Sciences industry', 'Experience with Veeva CRM data sets or other commercial Life Sciences data', 'Experience working in an agile software development environment', 'Experience working with Software as a Service and/or enterprise products', 'Experience with AWS', 'Hands on experience building models with deep learning frameworks (Tensorflow or similar)', 'Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.', 'Veeva Systems is an equal opportunity employer. Accordingly, we are committed to fair and accessible employment practices. Veeva Systems welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.']

['Apply Now', 'Qualifications', 'Working knowledge translating business requirements and product enhancements into quality assurance processes', 'Ability to translate complex business requirements for data analytics into simplified, manageable, detailed test cases', 'Experience working with complex relational databases; proficiency in writing and troubleshooting SQL code', 'Highly numerate, detail-oriented, and able to derive useful insights from data', 'Highly organized and able to balance multiple parallel projects', 'Experience with data warehousing systems is desirable.', 'Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Information Systems Technology or similar discipline', "Who You'll Work With", 'You will be based in Toronto, and be part of the Product Development team at PriceMetrix – part of McKinsey & Company. You will collaborate with a talented team of data engineers, web engineers, quality engineers, product managers, and others.', 'PriceMetrix is the first choice in practice management software for North American wealth managers. Our solutions use analytics and industry benchmarking to help advisers and their firms better serve their clients and grow their businesses. PriceMetrix directly measures aggregated data representing 10 million investors, $4 trillion in investment assets, 500 million transactions, and 2.5 million fee-based accounts. PriceMetrix combines its patented process for collecting and classifying data with proprietary measures of revenue, assets, and households to create the largest and most insightful retail wealth management data set available today.', 'PriceMetrix, part of McKinsey & Company’s Banking Practice, is the first choice in practice management software for North American wealth manager firms. PriceMetrix uses analytics and industry benchmarking to help financial advisors and their firms better serve their clients and grow their businesses.', "What You'll Do", 'You will assure the data quality of our SaaS business intelligence platform.', 'You will work in Agile teams of typically four to six colleagues. You will work closely with product owners to best translate business requirements and product enhancements into quality assurance processes. You will also collaborate with the team’s data engineers to guarantee requirements are met and high quality is maintained.', 'As a specialist in data quality assurance, you will contribute to testing strategies, develop functional and performance test cases, maintain testing environments, execute tests, and report test results. You will demonstrate technical skills in order to best analyze data, automate testing, deploy and operate data processes, and collaborate on troubleshooting.', 'You will strive to continuously enhance quality through the discovery of industry best practices, new tools, and techniques.']

['Why Join Coca-Cola North America??', 'It?s an exciting time to work in The Coca-Cola Company?s flagship market. We?re accelerating our momentum as the fastest-growing large consumer goods company in North America by putting people at the heart of our business and everything we do ? whether we?re innovating to give consumers the drinks and packaging sizes they want, or building our eCommerce capabilities. People are our focus when we?re collaborating with our diverse network of locally-connected bottling partners, and when we?re returning every drop of water we use to communities and nature. And people ? with the different backgrounds, skills and perspectives they bring to our workplace ? are helping transform our business, one big idea at a time. We empower our employees to challenge the status quo, make bold recommendations, experiment and adapt, so we can grow together and make a great business even better.', 'This role is a 1 year mat leave contract*', 'Job Summary', 'The Insights Manager is responsible for providing strategic thought leadership through accurate, actionable, and applied insights.? They collaborate with the Business Unit team members to identify the appropriate learning needs (syndicated and custom) for the business and commission custom research as required.? They will be responsible for driving new, innovative ideas based on insights and commercial viability (establishing there is consumer and customer demand, unique points of difference versus the competitive set, can become a sustainable concept).', 'Key Responsibilities', 'Leverages various information sources and identifies business issues impacting the brand and commercial actions.? Provides a strong, informed point of view on how to resolve the issue using research and/or commercial best practices.', 'Supports yearly business planning process through comprehensive summary and implications of past learning, Market Intelligence & Competitive Intelligence to feed the Situation Assessment phase (beginning) of planning.', 'Works collaboratively with Category Advisory to support the CBP process with shopper insights', 'Identifies the need to conduct custom research in order to address specific business issues.? Projects range from foundational learning on consumer/shopper/ brands/competitors (qualitative & quantitative), price/pack/product optimization studies (on-line conjoint, CLT, IHUT and in-market), impact studies (source of volume, trial & repeat, TURF, Market Mix, etc.), pre-market creative evaluation, post-market creative tracking;', 'Provides coaching/guidance to BU teams in self-serve insight resources such as Bev360 (Brand Health) and CBL (Consumer Beverage Landscape) databases, the CCV data mining tool and syndicated tools (Five)', 'Identifies and recommends best in class suppliers and research methodologies through industry and TCCC linkages Manages and prioritizes Nielsen Analyst? projects in accordance with BU priorities', 'Manages research suppliers to ensure data integrity, quality of delivery, and increased proficiency in storytelling capabilities', 'Job Requirements/Qualifications', 'At least 5-7 years in the Consumer Packaged Goods Industry, with substantial experience in Consumer, Brand, or Market Research', 'Strong analytic skills, with the ability to gather and synthesize data from multiple sources, interpret it and turn it into actionable insights', 'Consumer & Shopper Knowledge: Knowledge of consumer need states, shopping behaviour, trends, and cohort dynamics to effectively target marketing and merchandising efforts', 'Solid knowledge of different research techniques including the ability to design research approaches, sampling techniques and research protocols', 'Strong collaboration, influencing, prioritization and time management skills to service a large group of internal stakeholders/suppliers with potentially conflicting priorities.', 'Demonstrated verbal and written presentation capabilities; proficient with Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel and Word', 'Solid knowledge of mainstream quantitative analytic techniques (e.g., survey methods, segmentation, factor analyses, conjoint) used in market research', 'Comfortable with seeking out, recommending and employing emerging research techniques/methodologies to adapt to changing consumer/shopper trends (example: strategic/tactical social listening, on-line focus groups/bulletin boards, mobile research, virtual research, neuroscience, etc.)', 'Solid project management skills with ability to collaborate with key stakeholders (internal & external) and meet established timelines.', 'Solid capability in data mining and comfortable adopting data delivery platforms (TCCC-proprietary and Nielsen Answers Desktop/Workstation+)', 'Educational Requirements', 'University/Bachelor?s Degree', 'MBA preferred', 'Competencies - Leader Of Others', 'Develop Self and Others', 'Act like an Owner', 'Collaborate with System, Customer and Stakeholders', 'Drive Innovation', 'Inspire Others', 'Leadership Behaviors', 'DRIVE INNOVATION: Generate new or unique solutions and embrace new ideas that help sustain our business (encompassing everything from continuous improvement to new product and package innovation).', 'COLLABORATE WITH SYSTEM, CUSTOMERS, AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS: Develop and leverage relationships with stakeholders to approximately stretch and impact the System (Company and Bottler).', 'ACT LIKE AN OWNER: Deliver results, creating value for our Brands, our System, our customers, and key stakeholders.', 'INSPIRE OTHERS: Inspire people to deliver our mission and 2020 Vision, demonstrate passion for the business and give people a reason to believe anything is possible.', "DEVELOP SELF AND OTHERS: Develop self and support others' development to achieve full potential.", 'Travel Requirements', '10-20%', 'Relocation: ', 'Not provided', 'Coca-Cola Ltd. is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workforce.? We have a number of programs and policies in place to support this goal. For individuals with disabilities, accommodations are available upon request. Should you require an accommodation, please contact our HR team by calling 1-877-677-6774.', 'Our Growth Culture', 'One of the reasons our company continues to thrive after 130+ years is having a company culture that supports and rewards behaviors that lead to growth. Our “Growth Behaviors,” as we call them, are ways of being and working that help to make us successful. Think about how you can bring this to life in your next role at Coca-Cola.', 'Curious', 'Keep seeking, never settle. Staying curious about what is outside, and two steps ahead inspires us to challenge the status quo. Having the courage to look and leap is the way we grow. Because asking “what if?” pushes us to the next level as people and as a company.', 'Empowered', 'Make it happen', '.', ' True empowerment is the result of taking responsibility. This means giving yourself permission to see it, say it and do it, and owning the outcomes. Because we move forward faster when we all take action.', 'Version 1.0, 2.0, 3.0', 'Push for progress, not perfection. There are very few overnight successes. Greatness is borne of many little victories (and failures). Share v 1.0, test it, and make it better. Then create the next version. Because the moment we think something is perfect, it will be obsolete.', 'Inclusive', 'Include, value and trust each other. We are smart alone but together we are genius. This means being inclusive, giving the benefit of the doubt and being responsible for each other. Because, for our company to thrive for the next 100+ years, smart isn’t enough. We need genius.', 'We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.?', 'R-38880']

['President, KhureHealth', 'Khure Health is rapidly growing health technology company and an emerging leader in rare disease and speciality conditions. Through proprietary clinical dashboards and deep analytical tools, Khure Health allows physicians to quickly understand complex, high-risk patients and place them on the right care pathways.\xa0', 'Khure Health is looking for an enthusiastic and entrepreneurial leader to help lead the company at this early growth stage of the business.\xa0 The Khure Health platform allows physicians to identify misdiagnosed and undiagnosed patients in their practice using proprietary algorithms and machine learning techniques.\xa0 The result is that patients with rare and specialty conditions get the care they need faster, lives are saved, Doctors feel better supported and the pharmaceutical sector gets proper utilization of their therapies.', 'As President, you will own the P&L as well as the operational execution of the business.\xa0', 'The successful candidate will have an entrepreneurial spirit at their core and excel at keeping an eye on the long-term goals while rolling up their sleeves to help with the multiple short-term projects and priorities that compete for attention. In addition, you must have demonstrated abilities in building effective teams and scaling complex products.', 'This is an exciting time to join the Khure Health team. Khure Health, a joint venture between DoctorCare and Brainsparq, is in a period of tremendous growth and we are excited by the opportunities around us.\xa0', 'This position is located at our office in downtown Toronto.', 'Your Near Term Challenges:', '●\xa0 \tQuickly come up to speed on KhureHealth’s existing technology, partnerships, and product offering', '●\xa0 \tManage multiple live projects, leading stakeholder relations of our pharmaceutical partners as well as oversee our growing network of several hundred physician customers', '●\xa0 \tReview and work with the Ownership team to refine the ‘scale-up’ plan', '●\xa0 \tOversee our existing high performing team and continue to identify product & HR needs as we scale across the country', '●\xa0 \tMonitor and be responsible for all business KPIs\xa0', 'Here’s What You Offer:', 'You’re Entrepreneurial', '. You are excited by designing, launching and running high quality products. You try new ideas. You learn. You innovate.', 'You Hustle', '. You are able to independently identify what needs to get done and have a bias towards action.', 'You’re Humble', '. You are able to remove ego from discussions and identify the best solutions.\xa0 You are able to honestly reflect on your own weaknesses and look for ways to improve.', 'You’re Smart', '. You are able to quickly apply new knowledge to foreign situations and contribute to a high performing team.', 'You Lead.', ' You provide leadership to teams through your actions and support to your team members. You lead by example.', '\xa0', 'Primary Responsibilities & Activities:', '●\xa0 \tProvide clear direction to all direct reports and obtain results using a participative management style', '●\xa0 \tManage day-to-day operations and P&L', '●\xa0 \tComplete budgets, forecasts, and reports', '●\xa0 \tEnsure delivery of established targets', '●\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Lead continuous improvement activity and culture to solve problems and increase efficiency of team and operations', '●\xa0 \tHire, train, develop and evaluate Khure Health team members', '●\xa0 \tMaintain close working relationships with ["You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.", 'Job Description', 'Canadian Operations is a diverse group of teams – each committed to creating exceptional experiences for our clients. Without a doubt, our clients lie at the forefront of everything we do. We partner closely with each Canadian business unit to deliver the most efficient and effective customer service through training, process improvements, and technology optimization. With over 3,000 employees, our team members work in offices across Canada, including Montreal, Ottawa, Toronto and Waterloo. We also partner with our Sun Life team members in the Asia Service Centre offices in India and the Philippines to deliver exceptional customer service.', 'As part of the BEAM (Business Excellence AI and Machine learning) team, the Director, Data Science Initiatives will lead agile problem solving initiatives to conceptualize and develop data science solutions for specific use cases identified in collaboration with other Operations teams. They will provide intellectual leadership on the application of advanced machine learning and AI techniques to business problems, and coach a high-performance team of Data Scientists. This role will report to the AVP, Data Science Strategy & Initiatives.', 'What will you do?', 'Lead agile problem solving initiatives, collaborating within a cross-functional team of specialists:', 'Engage with business partners to assess data science use cases for feasibility and business impact, supporting prioritization discussions by senior management', 'Conduct end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.', 'Lead the development of machine learning and AI use cases using agile methodology', 'Build and maintain strong working relationships with Operations teams and other BUs to ensure successful delivery of initiatives.', 'Establish model monitoring metrics and performance reporting format as appropriate to each use case', 'Collaborate with implementation teams to operationalize successful use cases', 'Make business recommendations with effective presentations of findings at multiple levels of stakeholders.', 'Intellectual leadership', ' – contribute to and support team members in the following:', 'Research and source relevant data from internal business systems, external free and commercial data products', 'Apply machine learning and deep learning techniques to extract insights from available data', 'Use statistical methods to test findings through prototyping and scenario testing', 'Leverage business knowledge and judgement to prioritize approaches with a material financial impact', 'Use core AI and Big Data tools to solve business problems', 'Identify cutting edge algorithmic solutions available in AI domain that might be applicable to our business problems.', 'Extract actionable insights from unstructured datasets using advanced machine learning methods.', 'Coach and grow a high performance team with clear direction and proactive leadership:', 'Support employee development through on-the-job coaching, strategic assignment of responsibilities, and other training opportunities to create learning experiences for direct reports', 'Communicate priorities in alignment with team goals', 'Develop and maintain project roadmaps, assign responsibilities, and prepare resourcing plans to support completion of project deliverables and development of best practices.', 'Work with other teams and communities of practice to grow their understanding of AI and data science, highlighting applicability to their specific mandates and responsibilities.', 'Actively participate in internal collaboration groups and industry forums for data science practitioners; stay up to date on latest developments in industrial applications of AI.', 'What Do You Need To Succeed', 'University degree in math, computer science, or other relevant fields. Graduate degrees preferred.', 'Life and health insurance industry experience strongly preferred', '2+ years experience in a leadership role', '5+ years hands-on experience developing data science solutions in Python or R', 'What will be nice to have?', 'Extensive knowledge of machine learning and deep learning tools and concepts, including applications in NLP', 'Experience working with data from systems and technologies in large operations environments, relational databases and other data warehouse structures', 'Demonstrated collaboration skills working in a team environment across multiple sites and multiple business units', 'Proven ability to effectively communicate complex results to a business audience not familiar with data science and analytics', 'Ability to work on and steer multiple projects in parallel and manage fluctuating deadlines and priorities', 'Strong leadership and people management skills to foster a high performance, high engagement culture', 'What is in it for you?', 'Competitive salary and bonus structure influenced by market range data (Salary is not a constraint for the right candidate)', '4 weeks vacation', 'A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture', 'Being part of our Analytics community, where we share best practices and broaden skill-sets', 'The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.', 'Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.', 'Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com .', 'We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.', 'Salary Range', '92,000/92 000 - 150,300/150 300', 'Job Category', 'Advanced Analytics', 'Posting End Date', '15/03/2020']

JOB TITLE: ['Data Scientist, Financial Crimes and Cybersecurity, Senior Associate']
JOB DECSRIPTION: ['Line of Service', 'Advisory', 'Industry/Sector', 'FS X-Sector', 'Specialism', 'Fraud, Investigations & Regulatory Enforcement (FIRE)', 'Management Level', 'Senior Associate', 'Job Description & Summary', 'A career within our rapidly growing Financial Crime & Cyber (FC&C) practice will provide you with the opportunity to be part of our innovative and unique approach to combating financial crime. We help our clients with upfront strategy, intelligent automation, advanced AI and ongoing managed services, from both business and data & technology perspectives. Core components of the practice include the Financial Crime Unit (FCU), Cyber Resilience, Fraud, Anti-Money Laundering, Bribery, Sanctions, Corruption, Insider Threat, Trade Surveillance and Tax Evasion.', 'Working together, we bring a mix of capabilities to help clients with investigations, remediation, transformations, managed services and advanced analytic solutions. With the convergence of digital, PwC is delivering innovative and unique approaches to combating financial crime through updates to upfront strategy, utilization of intelligent automation, advanced artificial intelligence, ongoing managed services from both business and data & technology perspectives. Our solutions are designed to provide comprehensive support and defense against the growing prevalence of financial crime, at a critical time for our clients, as they rethink how they organize and deliver protection to their customers and employees.', 'To really stand out and make us ﬁt for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be an authentic and inclusive leader, at all grades/levels and in all lines of service. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.', 'Responsibilities', 'PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to', 'As a Senior Associate, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution.', 'Providing support on client assignments ', 'Constructing the analytical framework and work steps for each assignment', 'Consulting with clients to identify, clarify, and resolve complex issues critical to their strategic and operating success by developing insight, conducting independent analysis, and meeting with clients to assure assignment progress', 'Developing conclusions and recommendations, writing reports, assisting in client presentations and providing implementation assistance as required', 'Proactively assist in the management of several clients, while reporting to Managers and above', 'Establish effective working relationships directly with clients', 'Contribute to the development of your own and team’s technical acumen', 'Keep up to date with local and national business and economic issues', 'Be actively involved in business development activities to help identify and research opportunities on new/existing clients ', 'Continue to develop internal relationships and your PwC brand', 'Preferred Skills', 'Experience in cyber security, digital forensics and anomalous patterns recognition', 'Experience in advanced analytics by providing business intelligence solution; data models and BI reports', 'Experience in designing data warehousing with data pipeline, transformation and ETL orchestration, as well as standardising data governance, data catalog, metadata and lineage with regulatory requirements.', 'Data analytics project experience related to one or more of the following: transaction monitoring system implementation, development of customer risk rating models, customer segmentation, threshold tuning, and data quality assessments.', 'Ability to identify potential fraud, money laundering, patterns and inconsistencies using different analytical solutions/techniques', 'Strong statistical academic background, knowledge of quantitative methods, including predictive modeling techniques', 'Highly-skilled and good working knowledge of SQL, R, SAS, Python', 'Experience in creating documentation and executive presentation', 'Why you’ll love working for PwC', 'We want you to love every (if not, almost every) minute of your career, having said this, we get it. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.']

['Here at Rakuten Kobo Inc. we offer a casual working start-up environment and a group of friendly and talented individuals. Our employees rank us highly in terms of commitment to work/life balance. We realize that for our people to be innovative, creative and passionate they need to have healthy minds and bodies. We believe in rewarding all our employees with competitive salaries, performance based annual bonuses, stock options and training opportunities. ', '\xa0 ', 'If you’re looking for a company that inspires passion, personal, and professional growth – join Kobo and come help us make reading lives better. ', ' ', 'The Role:', ' ', 'Rakuten Kobo Inc. are seeking a Data Analyst to join our Big Data team. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Analytics, you will be part of a diverse, flexible, and collaborative environment where you will be able to work with unique and exciting data and directly impact the business on a daily basis. ', ' ', 'The Responsibilities:', ' ', 'Leverage the large amount of data collected in our ecosystem, from our: website, partners, apps, and eReaders to further our mission of making reading better for all. ', 'Apply your knowledge of statistics, experimental design and A/B testing to help business & product owners to make sound decisions based on meaningful data. ', 'Use your engineering expertise to evolve, modernize, and improve the performance and reliability of our data collection, aggregation, and analysis pipelines. ', 'Work with the BigData and Data Engineering team to tackle complex data & processing challenges. ', 'Present your findings to audiences of various technical backgrounds. ', 'Opportunities to expand into machine learning and other data science initiatives. ', ' ', 'Technical Requirements', ' ', 'B.Sc. In Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or related field ', '5+ Years of SQL experience ', '3+ Years of Python experience (Pandas, NumPy) ', '1+ Years of BigData Environment (Hadoop, Spark, Hive) ', '1+ Years using Data Visualization Tools (Tableau, Domo, Matplotlib) ', 'Working knowledge of the Unix shell environment ', ' ', 'Bonus Points', ' ', 'Experience using large datasets in eCommerce or marketing analysis ', 'Experience using job orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi) ', 'Familiarity with statistical tools such as R ', 'A passion for beautiful data visualizations ', 'Excellent communication and presentation skills ', ' ', 'The Perks:', ' ', 'Flexible hours and no office dress code ', 'Pooch Program that allows you to bring your furry friends to the office ', 'Full benefits starting from your first day ', 'Paid Volunteer days, unlimited sick days, and 3% RRSP matching ', 'Monthly commuting allowance ', 'Flexible health spending account ', 'Talent and development training budget ', 'Free Kobo device + free weekly e-book or audiobook ', 'Frequent Lunch and Learns Author series ', 'Weekly Kobo Tech University sessions ', 'Onsite gym ', 'Weekly happy hours (Thirsty Thursdays, as we like to call it) ', 'Maternity/paternity leave top up ', ' ', 'About Rakuten Kobo Inc.', ' ', 'Owned by Tokyo-based Rakuten and headquartered in Toronto, Rakuten Kobo Inc. is one of the most advanced global ecommerce companies, with the world’s most innovative eReading services offering more than 6 million eBooks and audiobooks to 30 million + customers in 190 countries. Kobo delivers the best digital reading experience through creative innovation, award-winning eReaders, and top-ranking mobile apps. Kobo is a part of the Rakuten group of companies. ', '\xa0 ', 'Rakuten Kobo Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Accessibility accommodations for candidates with disabilities participating in the selection process are available on request. Any information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially. ', '\xa0 ', 'Rakuten Kobo would like to thank all applicants for their interest in this role however only qualified candidates will be shortlisted. ', '\xa0 ', 'Rakuten Kobo will never ask you to pay or deposit any money as part of working with Kobo.  Similarly, Kobo will never ask in an email or online for your banking information or any government information about you, such as social security information.  If you encounter these fraudulent attempts, please send an email to [kobo-security]@rakuten.com with the relevant information, and do not respond to the sender.  All legitimate emails from Kobo are sent only from the domain @rakuten.com.']

['This Job is based in Australia', ' ', 'One of Australia’s leading research & teaching universities', ' ', 'Vibrant campus life with a strong sense of community & inclusion', ' ', 'Enjoy a career that makes a difference by collaborating & learning from the best', ' ', 'At UNSW, we pride ourselves on being a workplace where the best people come to do their best work.', 'THIS ROLE IS BASED IN SYDNEY, AUSTRALIA.', "The School of Mathematics and Statistics currently has more than sixty continuing academic staff and more than thirty research staff as well as visiting academics. UNSW is the only university in Australia to be ranked in the top 100 in the world in Mathematics and Statistics by each of the four ranking bodies: CWTS Leiden, ARWU, USNews, QS. The School embodies a broad range of research interests in the areas of applied and pure mathematics and statistics. It has particular research strengths in Algebra Analysis Number Theory, Bayesian and Monte Carlo Methods, Biomathematics, Biostatistics and Ecology, Combinatorics, Computational Mathematics, Data Science, Dynamical Systems and Integrability, Finance and Risk Analysis Fractional Calculus, Functional and Harmonic Analysis, Geometry and Mathematical Physics, Nonparametric Statistics, Ocean and Atmospheric Sciences, Optimisation, Stochastic Analysis, Stochastic Modelling. The School's research groups are interconnected, with frequent interactions between groups and with other schools and faculties both within and outside UNSW. The School is currently expanding its teaching and research programs in Data Science.", 'The School teaches approximately 10,000 individual students in 150 active courses in science, engineering and other areas. For administrative purposes, it is split into departments of Applied Mathematics, Pure Mathematics and Statistics.', "The School's undergraduate programs cover a wide spectrum of courses in Applied Mathematics, Pure Mathematics, Statistics and Data Science. Its postgraduate programs include coursework degrees, face-to-face delivery and online delivery (at Graduate Diploma and Masters levels) and vigorous research programs leading to MSc and PhD degrees. Currently the School has about 80 postgraduate students, of whom approximately 50 are enrolled in the PhD program.", 'About The Role', ' ', '$107K - $126K', ' plus 17% Superannuation and annual leave loading', ' ', 'Fixed Term – 5 years convertible tenure track', ' ', 'Full time (35 hours)', ' ', 'The Lecturer in Data Science will conduct research in Data Science & Statistics and align, where possible, with the existing research strengths in the School, contribute actively to the School’s teaching activities in Data Science and Statistics across a range of undergraduate and postgraduate courses, including online teaching and engage with the community and industry to build links in Data Science.', 'The role of Lecturer reports to the Head of School and has no direct reports.', 'Specific Responsibilities For This Role Include', ' ', 'Perform research in Data Science and Statistics with a view to publication in influential and high-impact scholarly journals.', ' ', 'Work both collaboratively and independently on research grant proposals and applications to national competitive grant agencies and other funding bodies.', ' ', 'Develop research collaborations within the School as well as links with other groups on campus and with industry.', ' ', 'Develop research collaborations nationally and internationally.', ' ', 'Actively disseminate research findings at seminars and conferences within the School, the UNSW environment, nationally and internationally.', ' ', 'Teach courses in Statistics and Data Science to a range of audiences at the University.', ' ', 'Teach specialist Honours and Masters level courses.', ' ', 'Supervise Honours and Masters Course Work projects; and supervise PhD and Masters Research students.', ' ', 'Contribute to the design and delivery of the School’s face-to-face teaching programs and courses.', ' ', 'Contribute to the design and delivery of the School’s online teaching programs and courses.', ' ', 'Actively participate in School activities and demonstrate an ability and willingness take on leadership roles in the School.', ' ', 'Undertake administrative duties as specified by the Head of School and participate in School, Faculty and/or University committees as required.', ' ', 'Cooperate with all health and safety policies and procedures of the university and take all reasonable care to ensure that your actions or omissions do not impact on the health and safety of yourself or others.', ' ', 'To Be Successful In This Role You Will Have', 'About the successful applicant', ' ', 'PhD or equivalent qualification in relevant mathematical sciences.', ' ', 'Demonstrated research ability in Data Science and Statistics.', ' ', 'Demonstrated ability to conduct research with other researchers in the School.', ' ', 'Evidence of effective teaching experience.', ' ', 'Evidence of research group collaborations.', ' ', 'Demonstrated capacity to conduct high quality research at an international level.', ' ', 'Strong publication record in top, peer-reviewed journals.', ' ', 'A record, or demonstrated ability, of success in external research funding.', ' ', 'Demonstrated ability to supervise PhD students.', ' ', 'Demonstrated experience in student supervision including, for example, Honours, Masters, Vacation Scholars projects.', ' ', 'Willingness to engage in teaching into online programs in Data Science and Statistics.', ' ', 'Excellent oral and written communication skills.', ' ', 'Excellent leadership skills, including competence in modelling behaviours that align with the ['StackAdapt is a self-serve programmatic advertising platform used by North America’s most exceptional digital marketers. Ad buyers plan, execute, and manage data-driven advertising campaigns across all devices, leveraging proprietary data, inventory and publisher partners.\xa0', 'Based out of our Toronto office, you will be part of the Programmatic Partnerships & Solutions (Inventory) team.\xa0 As part of the Programmatic Partnerships & Solutions team, you will work cross-functionally to bring together the best of StackAdapt’s capabilities.', '\xa0', "What You'll Be Doing:", 'Manage and resolve ad hoc Inventory requests', 'Troubleshoot technical campaign issues for high-value clients', 'Serve as a subject matter expert in quantitative analysis and data visualization to tell the story behind the numbers and influence decision-making', 'Own daily reporting/monitoring of our bidder health metrics - explain trends and derive high-level insights to communicate them to internal and external stakeholders', 'Drive the development of our bidder and product capabilities by defining features, targeting options, etc.', 'Manage and grow our relationships with new and existing SSPs; provide day-to-day direct SSP/exchange partner support', 'Become a subject matter expert on all supply-related industry updates and initiatives (e.g. privacy regulations, SPO, identity)', 'Liaise with the Engineering and Sales team to strategize and prioritize technical adoptions with external partners (e.g. RTB 2.5, TCF v2.0)', "What We're Looking For:", "Bachelor’s or Master's degree in a quantitative field, with a proven academic track record. We are looking for experienced, passionate, curious, customer-obsessed and entrepreneurial individuals to join a diverse and driven team whose mission is to help Canadians stay one step ahead of their busy lives. Voilà by Sobeys and Voilà par IGA will be the most reliable and convenient way for Canadians to shop for groceries. Your groceries delivered. key performance indicators and metrics to optimize site content and functionality as well as create data-driven insights about visitor behaviour from traffic patterns, order volume, conversion funnel, navigation behaviour and product selection', ' Establish regular reporting activities for internal and external stakeholders', ' Conduct analysis hands-on on customer and campaign data using analytical and statistical tools to uncover insights and program recommendations', ' Participate in digital projects as the measurement and analytics point-person, identifying reporting requirements, monitoring the technical implementation, and evaluating post-launch metrics', ' Participate in additional business intelligence activities related to data analysis and reporting as needed', ' Proactively identify opportunities and make recommendations to improve website and marketing campaign effectiveness by drilling into data to increase profitability and growth.', ' Troubleshoot, provide recommendation and solve issues related to marketing, product or merchandising issues using insight gained from detailed analysis', ' Identify, implement and integrate new KPI’s that can be used to benchmark the effectiveness of various engagement initiatives', ' Develop and implement best practices related to analyzing user behaviour across our digital properties, configuring web/mobile analytics technology, and interpreting data', ' Help drive business decision-making by educating and informing Voilà teams on digital metrics', ' Manage and execute Search Engine Optimization (SEO) efforts across all web properties', ' Manage and maintain Google Tag Manager (GTM)', ' Working as a key player within the integrated marketing campaign process to develop the content linking strategy, including deployment', ' Collaborate with product management team and Ocado on development the web user experience, delivery and maintenance', ' Collaborate with Digital & Media teams with Web analytics and support with overall Digital transformation of the organization through effective use of technology', ' Promote a culture of test and learn, by designing marketing tests, measuring the ['Kira Systems is a powerful machine learning software that identifies, extracts, and analyzes text in your contracts and other documents. Our software is intuitive and easy-to-use to uncover relevant information for some of the largest law firms, professional services and corporate companies in the world.', 'Kira Systems is looking for a computer scientist to join our research team. Research scientists at Kira Systems work on applied problems in their domain area, which in this role focuses on research into the behaviour of our users and how we can better facilitate their experience. In particular, they will work cross-functionality with a wide variety of teams to investigate, analyse, and characterize user behaviour, conduct and guide user studies to evaluate new modes of interaction, evaluate the performance of published techniques on our problems, devise novel algorithms, patent and subsequently publish new techniques. As an applied researcher you are expected to be able to implement prototypes and run experiments independently, and to subsequently work with development teams to produce production versions of successful methods.', 'What You Will Be Doing', 'Investigate how our users use our application, formulate derived insights into actionable product features, and facilitate rigorous user research across the organization.\xa0', 'Patent and publish successful novel methods.', 'Work with our design team to make our technology accessible to non-experts.', 'Work with our data analytics team to help characterize and understand user behaviour.', 'Help the development team productize research code and solve scaling problems.', 'Follow up the occasional “Mad Science” idea for feasibility.', 'What You Bring', 'PhD in human-computer interaction, interactive information retrieval or related field.', 'Publications in venues related to user research and human-computer interaction\xa0(e.g., CHI, IIiX. IUI, UMAP, CHIIR, SIGIR).', 'Proficiency with Python, Go, C/C++ or other languages to prototype techniques and conduct analysis.', 'Experience with user research, user studies, and qualitative and quantitative analysis.', 'Experience working with natural languages.\xa0', 'Why Join Kira Systems?', '\xa0', 'Team.', '\xa0Our team is filled with smart, curious, independent, self-motivated, and nice people. Together, we have a happy and fun team culture', "We're scaling.", '\xa0So, there are lots to still discover and develop - which makes for a great learning environment where you can build experiences', 'Personal Development.', '\xa0We work on challenging problems. It’s hard, in a good way.', 'Technology and Design.', '\xa0Machine learning is driving a new industrial revolution, and it’s terrific to work closely with this impactful technology. Moreover, we care about great design and a great customer experience.', 'Lots of benefits and perks', '\xa0- you can read about them here:\xa0www.kirasystems.com/careers', 'Kira Systems believes that at the foundation of our success are the people who work here. We are an equal opportunity employer and believe our diversity is a driver of success at our company. Any race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation or identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status are welcome here. Accommodations are available on request for all aspects of the selection process. Please be aware that due to the nature of our business all successful candidates must clear a background check before beginning employment.', 'Please be aware that due to the nature of our business all successful candidates must clear a background check before beginning employment.']

['Work Illustration', 'The Analyst, Operations is a position within Toronto Hydro’s new graduate development program and includes the opportunity to rotate through multiple departments over a 3 to 4 year period. The program is designed to offer successful candidates with opportunities to develop the necessary skills to become high performing professionals within the electric utility setting. Candidates may develop skills within areas that include: standards development, system and investment planning, maintenance and system reliability management, program management, design, and construction.', 'In addition to a cover letter and resume, all applicants must submit a copy of their most recent Transcript.', 'The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies, and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.', 'Key Responsibilities', ' ', 'Interacts with stakeholders to identify, capture and analyze business requirements ', ' ', 'Supports departmental activities to draw insights from relevant business unit data sets and make recommendations for action', ' ', 'Conducts analysis involving large data sets and multiple variables and presents effectively through the preparation of technical or business reports and studies, process maps, graphs, charts or tables ', ' ', 'Assists analysis', ' ', 'Provides support to management and technology systems including enterprise systems (i.e., SAP), data management and reporting', ' ', 'Evaluates and makes recommendations on the current and future state and is a strong team player with demonstrated success in driving data-driven operations', ' ', 'Acts as departmental subject matter expert for departmental, divisional and/or corporate initiatives', ' ', 'Stays current with industry developments and practices, specifically those in investment planning and information technology areas', ' ', 'Works in accordance with safety performance standards and promotes a safety culture', ' ', 'Reuirements', ' ', 'University degree in Engineering (Electrical Engineering preferred)', ' ', 'Graduating in 2020', ' ', 'Knowledge of and experience in utility operations is an asset', ' ', 'Proficient in data management practices and capable of extracting, querying, and analyzing large data sets; intermediate knowledge of programming languages (e.g., R, Python, C/C++, VBA) to support data analytics is an asset', ' ', 'Knowledge of Tableau, Alteryx and/or SAP an asset', ' ', 'Knowledge of, and experience with, machine learning and neural network algorithms in practical applications an asset', ' ', 'Fully proficient in the use of Microsoft Office applications including advanced working knowledge in MS Excel, MS Project, MS Access and MS Word', ' ', 'Awareness of project management processes, principles and methodologies', ' ', 'Business and strategic thinking acumen', ' ', 'Understanding of statutory and regulatory obligations related to the electric utility industry', ' ', 'Excellent analytical, technical, and business solution development skills, including the proven ability to function effectively in a dynamic environment.', ' ', 'Strong written and verbal communication skills.', ' ', 'Strong problem solving and decision-making skills.', ' ', 'Builds Strong Relationships: Invests in building valuable relationships across the organization and externally to support the future of Toronto Hydro', ' ', 'Develops Culture & People: Recognizes personal development and a strong organizational culture are integral components of an effective organization', ' ', 'Champions Change, Productivity and Innovation: Invests in innovation, continuous improvement and productivity as essential drivers ['Derivatives Analyst', 'Derivatives Branch', 'Permanent Full-Time', 'File #19-99', 'The\xa0Ontario Securities Commission (OSC)', '\xa0is the statutory body responsible for regulating Ontario’s capital markets in accordance with the mandate established in the provincial Securities Act and the Commodity Futures Act. The Commission’s mandate is to provide protection to investors from unfair, improper or fraudulent practices, to foster fair and efficient capital markets and confidence in capital markets, and to contribute to the stability of the financial system and the reduction of systemic risk. This mandate is performed through policy, operational, adjudication and enforcement work. The OSC also contributes to national and global securities regulation development.', 'We offer a diverse, fair and flexible work environment and take pride in our challenging and rewarding work.', 'The\xa0', 'Derivatives Branch', "\xa0assists the OSC in the delivery of its strategic goals and priorities through policy development, regulatory advice and research and by support for the OSC's business planning, policy prioritization and risk management processes. A core component of the OSC's strategic direction is to expand the organization's research and analytical capabilities to be able to respond to and keep pace with market developments and investor concerns. As a part of this focus we are seeking a Derivatives Analyst. This is an excellent opportunity to influence the regulation of derivative markets in Ontario.", 'Overview', 'Reporting to the Manager, Derivatives, the\xa0Derivatives Analyst', '\xa0is responsible for the analysis of derivatives transaction data, provides guidance on policy in terms of OTC derivatives reporting and oversight of trade repositories, and designs database solutions to address the business needs of storing, loading and managing the OTC derivatives data and to provide statistics, visualizations, analysis and commentary on the data collected.', 'This role also represents the OSC in a supporting capacity on internal and external committees related to derivatives trade repositories practices and regulatory reporting requirements including collaboration on consultation papers recommending guidance for regulators and market participants.', 'What will you do?', '\xa0', 'Conduct analysis of OTC derivatives data across all asset classes, instruments and types including understanding all major derivatives types in terms of their different economic characteristics, methods to value and price', 'Monitor developments of regulatory structures and practices in Ontario and other jurisdictions related to derivatives data to identify best practices', 'Review and interpret domestic and international securities laws and rules related to derivatives data and database development', 'Work and communicate with national and international trade repositories to meet the OSC’s OTC derivative data reporting and analysis needs for OTC derivatives across all asset classes, instruments and types that exist in the OSC’s derivative’s database.', 'Provide input into international guidance of derivatives regulatory reporting and data standards', 'Support data management activities for big data sets and associated technology; helping to ensure the quality of OTC derivatives data and its oversight meets the OSC’s OTC derivative data reporting and analysis needs', 'Coordinate the manipulation and transformation of data used for analysis to solve unique complex problems using computer programming by creating algorithms to help with the analysis of OTC derivatives and reference data', '\xa0', 'What you need to be successful in the role:', '\xa0', 'Undergraduate degree in Business/Commerce/Finance/Accounting/ Computer Science or equivalent', '3-5 years of experience in trading, treasury, clearing, risk management, structured products or other similar areas with extensive knowledge of derivatives products, primarily over-the-counter', 'Knowledge of derivatives, primarily over-the-counter.', 'Completion of the Canadian Securities Course (CSC), the Derivatives Fundamentals Course, or Chartered Financial Analyst or completion of Level 1', 'Excellent analytical skills and ability to think outside the box', 'Ability to work well with individuals at all levels and across sectors and jurisdictions', 'Superior communication skills, both written and oral and ability to draft reports and briefing material, submissions and other reports using plain language', 'Must be able to clearly articulate difficult financial concepts', 'Grow your career and make a difference working at the OSC.', 'Apply online by\xa0April 3, 2020.', 'We thank all applicants for their interest in the Ontario Securities Commission. We will contact those selected for an interview.', '\xa0', 'The OSC is committed to providing an inclusive workplace environment that meets the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities.\xa0Please go to\xa0', 'Accessibility at the OSC\xa0to review the OSC’s policies on accessibility and accommodation in the workplace.']

['The role is responsible for designing, developing, manipulating and maintaining financial reporting systems, as well as interpreting data that influence and drive decisions. This includes identifying needs, creating process improvement solutions, working with multiple stakeholders and maintaining collaborative relationships with business partners.', 'To be successful in the role, the candidate brings a solid working knowledge of SQL, Tableau, Python and process automation. In addition, the candidate is a self-starter with a passion for providing various ways to improve effectiveness within the business.', 'You Will Be Accountable To', ' Meet with various business units to understand their needs, identify the business problem, determine, define and deploy predictive/prescriptive analytic solutions to meet business objectives.', ' Prepare, extract data and perform data manipulation by using various programming language (SQL, Python etc.).', ' Use machine learning methods or other data mining techniques to get insights from massive datasets.', ' Work closely with data analysts, data engineers, data scientist and other team members on projects and ad-hoc requests.', ' Communicate approaches, findings and recommendations to business stakeholders.', ' Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential information.', 'Your Experience Includes', ' Bachelor or Masters’ degree in an analytical field of study e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics, Finance, Computer Science.', ' 3 - 5 years of work experience directly related to quantitative analysis, with proven results.', ' Familiar with tools such as SQL/Python/Data Bricks or other tools for large scale data analysis.', ' Solid knowledge and some hands-on experience with various machine learning algorithms e.g. time series analysis, anomaly detection, cluster analysis, decision trees, random forest, SVM.', ' Superb analytical and conceptual thinking skills to not only manipulate but also derive meaningful interpretations from data.', ' Ability to take initiative, multi-task, and is a good team player in a fast-paced environment.', ' Strong detail orientation is essential in this role.']

JOB TITLE: ['Manager - Global City Relations and Business Development ']
JOB DECSRIPTION: ['The Toronto-based World Council on City Data (WCCD) is looking for a passionate and innovative leader ready to help us service, maintain and grow our expanding international network of 100 cities across 39 countries. With 7-10 years of experience, you are used to working with C-suite executive and global stakeholders to create, implement and manage business processes while maximizing returns. You are a skilled project manager, able to work efficiently and effectively across various departments of our organization while helping to hone and implement a sustainable growth plan for the WCCD. An ability to work with the communications specialists, the data analysts team, and the Executive leadership to derive data-driven insights and other products essential to city member retention and new city uptake is a core focus of this position. You are an innovative leader capable of creating forward-thinking strategies around network expansion and retention. Relationship builders with an understanding of public sector engagement are encouraged, though private sector experience is extremely relevant to the position.', 'Furthermore, you will collaborate with our team to build meaningful partnerships with all stakeholders that will help carry out the vision of the organization.\xa0Exceptional writing skills are essential.\xa0While based in Toronto, international travel will be required.', 'The WCCD is a not-for-profit organization that makes city data usable across the globe. We create ISO standards for city performance metrics and deploy them globally while telling data-driven stories and running innovative analytics. Our data powers informed policy decisions around the world and is a trusted source for city mayors, companies, and citizens everywhere. ', 'Critical Skills', 'Developing new and existing client relationships', 'Managing the end to end process of onboarding cities, through the WCCD ISO-certification process, and ensuring annual renewal for all cities in the growing global network', 'Working with a fast-growing pipeline of cities globally, your role will be to solidify our city partners, help further expand the organization globally, and ensure a sustainable revenue stream. This will be done through product sales and pipeline building. The successful candidate will further expand our organization and enter new markets globally', 'You will have to analyze our programs & initiatives, our value proposition and understand what city stakeholders need and want as members of the WCCD. At the end of the day, your actions should make the organization scale and bring WCCD to a new level.', 'Stakeholder engagement: Developing new partnerships is key, but maintaining these relationships is essential. Unique to WCCD, we have multiple activities (including global meetings and panels with UN and other organizations) and we are developing products (that include data visualization, global city reports, indices, data tools for comparative benchmarking, etc.), that city stakeholders can engage in. Your role will be to network with these stakeholders and ensure a great partnership is built that is mutually beneficial to the partners and most importantly beneficial to the ecosystem.', 'File and Data management: You will support WCCD in building our CRM, creating a sustainable infrastructure that is conducive to proper data and files management, both online and offline which is key for our organization. Working with our City Relationship team and our executive team, to build our partnership pipeline is key.', 'Understanding blockages and impediments to growth/retention, while proactively seeking and implementing solutions', 'Excellent written and verbal communication skills', 'Demonstrated ability to work across different departments, and work with all stakeholders to create, manage and implement sound expansion and retention practices', 'Significant project management experience, including working with both public grants and private sector involvement', 'An ability to undertake horizon-scanning for city data related initiatives globally (e.g. across cities and countries, and international organizations such as the World Bank and United Nations', 'A willingness and passion for expanding a global network through nuanced and stakeholder-specific engagement', 'A good eye for visual branding and excellent attention to detail', 'A proven track record in working across departments to hone audience-specific messaging to diverse stakeholders', 'Ability to influence across the global network at multiple levels in the organization', 'Strategic thinking with good judgment and strong conceptual thinking skills', 'Experience providing communications support to senior leadership', 'Requirements', 'A bachelors degree is required and additional, demonstrated qualifications in specialist degrees and/or certifications are considered an asset (for example, PMP)', 'An MBA is an asset', 'Sales experience considered an asset', 'Language skills considered an asset', '7-10 years of experience - ideally in both the public and private sector', 'A legal ability to work in Toronto', 'Reporting to the WCCD Senior Executive Team, the Manager of Global City Relations and Business Development will have responsibilities across the organization, including several direct reports who liaise daily with cities and stakeholders worldwide. You will also have the responsibility to grow and evolve this city relationship team, as needed. You also will be an essential part of the WCCD’s senior management team, now under expansion. ', 'Please send a CV and a one-page letter of motivation to info@dataforcities.org. This position is based in Toronto. The WCCD is unable to provide relocation expenses.']

['Summary', 'Do you want to join a rapidly growing Toronto startup disrupting a $40B industry? At Wonolo, our mission is to make work flexible and fulfilling for everyone. Every day, we are creating opportunities for people to make extra income, learn new skills, and change their lives. At the same time, we are saving companies money by efficiently connecting them with talented people and redesigning the recruitment process for many industries. We are backed by leading investors including Sequoia Capital, Bain Capital Ventures, DAG Ventures, PivotNorth, Base 10, among others.', 'We’re looking for a Data Analyst who loves to dive deep into the data and pull out actionable insights, help run experiments, and build permanent reporting for an extremely eager set of business stakeholders.', "What You'll Do", 'Our product is a mobile platform where companies post job openings and workers sign-up, accept and work the jobs. ', 'We need a data analyst dedicated to analyzing and reporting on all aspects of our business (both sides of our market). ', 'The work will include ad-hoc feature analysis and engagement insights, enhancing our suite of permanent reporting, designing and executing our a/b testing, and helping us implement our more advanced data science projects. ', 'This position will be set within our ‘Engineering, Product, and Design’ department working on the ‘Data & Integrations’ team. ', 'The opportunity is to work closely with many business stakeholders including Product, Supply Operations, and Sales/Business Operations.', 'Who You Are', '3-5 years of experience, preferably analyzing Mobile or Web engagement', 'Advanced SQL, preferably with a columnar store (Snowflake, Redshift, Vertica)', 'Experience with Looker for reporting is required', 'Good grasp of intermediate probability and statistics', 'The mind and attitude of an analyst', 'Thorough checking of raw and final results', 'Strong desire to advance and learn more analytics and data science', 'Comfortable with at least one analytics/data science language (R, Python, etc…)', 'Ability to understand and construct experimental design, up to and including Supervised Learning (the more the better)', 'The confidence to stand behind the results and present to various business stakeholders and executives', 'Comfortable pulling and manipulating data from a variety of APIs and endpoints', 'Benefits And Perks', 'The opportunity for growth in a mission-driven and well-funded start-up.', 'Competitive salary and meaningful equity.', 'We pay 100% insurance (medical/dental/vision) premiums.', 'Laptop, cell phone reimbursement.', 'Life and disability insurance.', 'Open vacation policy, flexible schedule, and work-from-home Fridays.', 'Team outings, happy hours, and company off-sites.', 'About Wonolo', 'Wonolo is striving to change the way companies find talent for their immediate work needs. Every day, we are creating flexible opportunities for people to make extra income, learn new skills, and change their lives. At the same time, we are saving companies money by connecting them with talented people and redesigning the recruitment process for many industries.', 'We are backed by leading investors including Sequoia Capital, Bain Capital Ventures, DAG Ventures, PivotNorth, Base 10, and AMN Healthcare, among others.', 'Learn More About Us', 'Life at Wonolo', 'TechCrunch', 'Fortune', 'Crunchbase', 'Wonolo is a Great Place to Work Certified company for delivering a consistently high-trust experience for all employees. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees.']

['\xa0', 'Business Intelligence Engineer - Data Science', 'You are adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. We are seeking someone who has experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing predictive models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. The ideal candidate will report to the Director of IT and support our operations, sales, marketing and finance teams with insights gained from analyzing company data.', 'You must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights and must be comfortable working with senior management and functional teams in a high growth environment. If you have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes, apply now!', 'What you’ll do:', 'Utilize existing research and data, while proactively integrating new sources of data and information to ensure the most impactful and relevant insights are brought to life for our teams through interactive dashboards', 'Collaborate with the Director of IT to build a centralized database used to aggregate company-wide data and drive automated solutions across all departments\xa0', 'Conduct competitive analysis to determine the strategic position of the company and identify growth opportunities\xa0', 'Develop sales forecasts using various methods, enabling our sales team to make informed business decisions and predict short and long-term performance', 'Lead the development and execution of consumer research, both primary and secondary, for new product launches and ongoing maintenance to assist with marketing and sales optimization initiatives', 'Partner with cross-functional leaders to understand learning objectives that will inform both quantitative and qualitative research development, deployment, and analysis to drive actionable recommendations and thoughtful decisions about the future of our company', 'Set the direction for research priorities based on what will bring the best products to market for our current and future customers, informing concept ideation and validation through sample testing and monitoring pre and post-launch success\xa0', 'Work with our Finance and Communications teams on developing communication materials for investors and other external stakeholders', 'Collaborate with the Director of Operations to identify pain points in cash cycle process (cash processing, pickup) monitoring lead times, optimizing inefficiencies. Reducing working capital requirements on machines.', '\xa0', '\xa0', 'Who you are:', '5-8 years relevant work experience in highly strategic and analytical roles with proven ability to transform insights into action', 'Quantitative and qualitative research experience with range of methodologies and tools is a must, and the candidate should be comfortable with presenting findings to key stakeholders including Co-Founders', 'Curious problem solver that is focused on developing clear research plans that identify the best methods for delivering actionable, results-driven decisions', 'Detail-oriented mindset with strong project management, process, and organizational skills; can prioritize effectively to manage multiple projects, and varied timelines', 'Collaborative working style with ability to build strong cross-functional relationships and influence decision-making through both written and verbal communication', 'You have advanced knowledge working with SQL, Data Studio, Tableau, Microsoft excel, Google big query and analytics / presentation tools, pulling data from API resources as well as familiarity with JIRA', 'You have experience with technologies such as Python, or R, as well as familiarity with conventional code and programming concepts', 'Hard working with a "no task is too small" attitude', 'Enjoy working in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment', '\xa0', 'You’ll love working at Localcoin because:', 'We love crypto.', ' We believe that everyone should be able to own cryptocurrency and have a deep understanding of blockchain technology. You’ll have full access to Localcoin products to ensure your journey with cryptocurrency is seamless. That means you’ll be able to purchase cryptocurrencies supported by Localcoin below the Canadian market rate with zero fees! You’ll also gain insider access with discount coupons to products like our Prepaid Visa Card and the use of our ATMs nationwide!\xa0\xa0', 'We’re not just employees. We’re people.', ' We have a strong commitment to support our employees’ wellbeing both inside and outside of the office. We offer unlimited travel insurance so you can get that R&R worry free, a customizable health and wellness plan with all the bells and whistles including an annual allowance spend account, a super convenient location on Yonge street with a flexible schedule to avoid the busy rush hour times, and a kitchen stocked with snacks and coffee to keep you fueled throughout the day.', 'We’ll invest in your career. ', 'Our company’s growing quickly, and we’ll give you the opportunity to do the same. You’ll have access to a number of professional development opportunities so that you can keep up with the company’s evolving needs and grow your career along the way.\xa0', 'We’re creating an environment where everyone can thrive.', ' Our customers are nation-wide and diverse, so we’re building a team that is, too. Through initiatives like our company-wide teach and training days, opportunities to attend industry events, and allowing time for you to focus on self-development during the work day, we’re truly building an inclusive environment where people can bring their best selves to the office.\xa0', 'We offer competitive compensation packages.', ' We deeply value the talent and impact our team brings to the table, and believe that fair and equitable total compensation packages are part of our commitment to everyone who works here.\xa0', 'And so much more...', ' family style catered lunch every Monday, quarterly team outings, weekly team socials, open concept office with themed breakout rooms to suit your working style, and organized volunteer opportunities to give back to our local communities.\xa0', 'Sound like something you want to be part of? We’re hiring! Apply today to ', 'careers@localcoin.ca', '\xa0']
